Hi this is Ceema and today I’m gonna bring
you a new lesson on expressions that you use

when you are changing your decision. Now what
is a decision? Well, a decision is a choice

that you make about something or anything,
when you have to think through several different

possibilities. So you can decide or make a
choice to have Vanilla ice cream, Chocolate

ice cream, Strawberry ice cream or maybe any
other kind of flavor. But you decide to have

Strawberry ice cream, but sometimes we want
to change that choice or change that decision.

Now what I’m gonna do today is I’m gonna
tell you various expressions that you can

use, when you have to change your decision,let’s
look at what they are.
The first one is I changed my mind. Well, this is probably the most often used expression, you are going

to use when you change your decision, when
you change your choice, when you change your

opinion. So you can say something like, I
hated my Professor, but I’ve changed my

mind about it, or you can say I wanted to
lunch , but I changed my mind , I decided

to go for a movie instead. This is the most
commonly used expression. We will go to some

uncommon ones, so for example if you go for
something like, I had a change of heart, so

you say I had a change of heart. When do you
use this expression? You use it when, you

are talking about a change in your feelings,
in your attitude 
and in your behavior. And mind you more often

than not, this expression is used towards
a change of feelings, attitudes and behavior,

mostly in a positive direction or in a more
positive approach. So you can say something

like I decided to punish my son for what he
had done, but then I had a change of heart.

Maybe my attitude toward punishing my son
changed. I decided it wasn’t very important

to punish him, rather than to correct him
with love. So that’s when you use the expression

change of heart. Moving on to the next one,
we have Hang on a minute. When would you use

the expression Hang on a minute? Now a lot
of times, when you are making a decision or

when you have already made it. You are debating
with yourself, about the decision that you’ve

made, you’re not very sure now. In fact
after having made the decision, you still

need time to think. So you may ask the other
person to wait. Suppose you are on a call,

with your phone company to order a new handset,
and the person on the other line tells you,

Mrs. Rodgers would you like to pick the phone
at the store? Or would you like me have it

deliver it your house? Now initially you decided
that you are gonna pick it up at the store.

But then you’re like hang on a minute, because
now you are debating with yourself whether

is it the right decision for me to go to a
store, wherein I could have saved time and

money, by having it delivered to my house?So
you need time to think, you are still debating

on a decision that you have already made.
Next expression, On second thought. Sometimes

we’ve made a decision already, and after
having made the decision, we kind of give

it ample or a lot of consideration or a lot
of thought. You’ve thought through a decision

that you’ve already made, and after thinking
about it, after having made it. You think

that maybe I have a better idea. So you have
a better idea, after having made a decision.

So when you have a better idea, after having
made your initial decision, that’s when

you say on second thought. So for example
you may say something like, I decided to speak

to the HR Manager about this issue, but no
wait on second thought, I decided I’m going

to lodge a formal written complaint. So you’ve
actually decided to do something, but then

after having thought about it more, you have
a better idea, as compared to your original

idea, and therefore you say on second thought,
you’ve changed your mind, you’ve changed

your decision. The next two expressions are
pretty much similar, but the first expression

between these two is used in an informal way
, and this one is used in a formal way or

maybe at work or in office, Upon reflection,
what does that mean? This expression upon

reflection is again used when you have made
a decision, and then given it lots of thought,

which is then made you change your mind. So
for example you could say something like,

upon reflection I decided that we do not need
to have a family vacation this year, we need

to save a lot of money instead, so we are
not going to spend on family vacation. So

you have initially decided or made your decision
to have a family vacation, but then you gave

a lot of thought to it and then you changed
your decision. So upon reflection, you thought

that, no we are gonna save money, we are not
going to go with our original decision. As

I said the next expression is pretty much
the same as this one, it is used you know

in the same way as this one, but it is used
in a formal environment, like at office or

at work, that’s where this expression is
used, so you can say something like, after

further consideration, we decided that Mr.
John is one of the best candidates for this

job, so we decided to hire him. So you may
have had a different decision about somebody

else to be hired for that job, but then after
thinking about it, you thought that, no we’ll

have John for the job he is the best candidate.The
next expression to change your decision is

He convinced me, the other word for that would
be He persuaded me. So sometimes you’ve

made a decision, but somebody else comes along
and influences you to change your decision.

So you could say something like, I decided
to study very hard after going home, but my

friend took me along with her to party, or
she convinced me to you know spend a day at

her house and do something else. So you’ve
made a decision, but someone influences you

to change it. That’s when you are convinced
or persuaded to do something else. The next

expression is I’m not sure, what I was thinking
when I you know this depends on what situation

we are talking about, so I’m not sure what
I was thinking, when I applied for the job.

You made a decision to work at a certain job,
but that job is not meant for you, now you

are stressed, you are harrowed; you are so
worried every time. So I’m not sure what

I was thinking, when I was doing something.
Basically is used when your decision that

was made in the past, was not even a logical
one, or you could say I’m gonna break up

with Mark. I’m not sure, what I was thinking,
when I decided to see him, because your decision

in the past was not a logical one. You probably
haven’t thought about it too much, before

having made that decision. And the last one
is I did a one eighty. A one eighty is 180

degree. We all know what a 180 degree is right.
It is the opposite; we are talking about,

doing something the opposite of what you have
decided to do in the first place. So when

you have a total opposite feeling or attitude
toward a decision that you’ve made previously

, that’s when you would say I did a one
eighty. So you could say something like, I

decided to stay away from my parents, do not
talk with them, but then I did a one eighty

and then I realized, that whatever they’ve
done for me was meant for my good. So you

did a one eighty, your feelings, your attitudes
toward a certain thing or people have changed

in total different way in the very opposite
direction. Well, these are some expressions

used to change your mind, to change your choice
and change your decision. I’m sure you’ll

find them very informative, when you speak
English in your everyday life. I’ll be back

with some more lessons, until then this is
me saying take care.
